CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 19, 1961, pg. A15, reads: "HAPPY COUPLE - Mr. and Mrs. James S. Ligons smile happily after their wedding last Saturday at Metropolitan Baptist Church. The bride is ex-Junior Courier reporter, Verna Stevenson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles E. Stevenson. - Harris Photo."  Portions of article read: "Ex-Junior Courier Scribe Become Mrs. James Ligons - One of the season's prettiest weddings united ex-Junior Courier reporter, Verna Stevenson, and James S. Ligons.  The bride, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Stevenson, is a graduate of Robert Morris Business School.  The groom is a graduate of Business Training College.  The nuptials took place Aug. 12 at Metropolitan Baptist Church, with the Rev. William Harris, cousin of the groom, officiating, and the Rev. O. L. Simms assisting.  Miss Patricia Miles was soloist and George Stevenson, uncle of the bride, organist.   Mrs. Lois Lee Dorsey directed the wedding.  Given in marriage by her father, the bride wore a floor length gown of Chantilly lace trimmed in heart sequins and pearls and matching heirloom veil.  Miss Geraldine Johnson was her maid of honor.  She wore orchid chiffon.  The bridesmaids were Sandra Cole, Sharon Ann Ligons, and Audrey Gorman.  Their gowns were white chiffon.  Debra Stevenson, sister of the bride, was the flower girl.  Kevin Copeland, cousin of the bride carried the rings on a satin pillow.  Frank Ligons was best man and ushers were Robert Robinson, Lloyd Briscoe and Charles Stevenson..."
TitMainTitle: Groom James S. Ligons wearing light colored dinner jacket, and bride Verna Stevenson Ligons wearing lace wedding gown with full skirt and long lace fingerless gloves, posed in Metropolitan Baptist Church, another version
